attributes.action: Provide funding for collection and storage of umbilical cord blood cells; and to make cord blood donation an ‘Opt Out’ option, whereby cord blood after babies’ delivery is automatically collected and stored, unless mother specifically ‘Opts Out’ of the scheme.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Cord blood cells are ‘naïve’ cells found in the umbilical cord of a baby, and have the ability to develop into bone marrow once transplanted into a patient. Because these cells are naïve it means the risk of rejection and graft vs. host disease is reduced; it also means that donor-recipient matching is less stringent, thus making it easier to transplant rare tissue types, Asians and Afro-Caribbean patients.

The collection procedure is non-invasive and harmless to the mother and baby, and can save the lives of thousands of children. It is a shame that in a developed and technologically advanced country as the UK, we waste such a safe and readily available source of life. 

Imagine all the opportunities missed to save children’s lives when each day the NHS incinerates thousands of umbilical cords as waste.

Please help save lives by signing this petition, you have nothing to lose, but thousands out there have a lot to gain.

Finally, when this petition becomes law, please remember to donate your baby’s cord blood and save a life!
